titleInfo.title: Passantino-Miller et al v. Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER of RECUSAL signed by Judge William B. Shubb on 2/21/12: Judge William B. Shubb is hereby RECUSED from this action. This case is reassigned to Judge Garland E. Burrell, Jr., and Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd for all further proceedings. The new case number is 2:12-0420 GEB DAD. Any dates previously set in this case are hereby VACATED. (Kastilahn, A)

titleInfo.title: Passantino-Miller et al v. Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., et al
titleInfo.subTitle: STIPULATION and ORDER to continue Motion Hearing signed by Judge Garland E. Burrell, Jr. on 4/26/2012. Defendants' 18 Motion to Dismiss First Amended Complaint is RE-SET for 6/4/2012 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 10 (GEB). Plaintiff shall file their Opposition by 5/14/2012. Defendants to file their Reply by 5/25/2012. (Marciel, M)

titleInfo.title: Passantino-Miller et al v. Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., et al
titleInfo.subTitle: STATUS (PRETRIAL SCHEDULING) ORDER signed by Judge Garland E. Burrell, Jr., on 6/5/12 ORDERING that the status (pretrial scheduling) conference set for hearing on 6/11/2012, is VACATED. Plaintiffs' motion for class certification shall be filed no later than 3/11/2013, and set for hearing on 5/20/2013 at 9:00 a.m.. Defendants' opposition is due by 4/15/2013, and Plaintiffs' reply is due by 5/6/2013. Designation of Expert Witnesses due by 11/8/2013, and any contradictory and/or rebuttal expert disclosure due by 12/13/2013. Discovery is due by 4/11/2014. The last hearing date for a motion is 6/16/2014 at 9:00 a.m.. Final Pretrial Conference is SET for 8/4/2014 at 01:30 PM in Courtroom 10 (GEB) before Judge Garland E. Burrell, Jr.. Trial is SET for 11/4/2014 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 10 (GEB) before Judge Garland E. Burrell, Jr.. (Kastilahn, A)

titleInfo.title: Passantino-Miller et al v. Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., et al
titleInfo.subTitle: STIPULATION and ORDER signed by Judge Garland E. Burrell, Jr on 8/31/12: Defendants' Motion to Dismiss, presently scheduled for hearing on September 10, 2012, is taken off the Court's calendar. Plaintiffs shall file a Second Amended Complaint on or before September 30, 2012. Defendants shall have 30 days to respond to Plaintiffs' Second Amended Complaint. (Kaminski, H)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:12-cv-00420; Passantino-Miller et al v. Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., et al;

titleInfo.title: Passantino-Miller et al v. Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting in part and denying in part 39 Motion to Dismiss signed by Judge Garland E. Burrell, Jr on 1/3/13; Defendant's dismissal motion is granted and denied in part. The motion is granted as to Plaintiffs' breach of contract and breach of the covenant of good faith and fair dealing claims; the motion is denied as to Plaintiffs' TILA and section 17200 claims. Plaintiffs are granted fourteen (14) days from the date on which this order is filed to file a Third-Amended Complaint addressing the deficiencies of any dismissed claim. (Matson, R)

(Zignago, K.)

titleInfo.title: Passantino-Miller et al v. Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., et al
titleInfo.subTitle: STIPULATION and ORDER signed by District Judge Troy L. Nunley on 6/3/2013 ORDERING that Plaintiffs' complaint against Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., is DISMISSED, with prejudice. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Court retains jurisdiction to enforce the terms of the parties' confidential Settlement Agreement. (Zignago, K.)
